ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: A.Legal Awareness Programme organised with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women. Legal Awareness Programme was organised in Murshidabad District in West Bengal with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women in 2014-15. NCW provided a financial assistance of Rs. 200000. Organised at Venue: Talgram on 14th and 15th February 2015. The objective of the Legal Awareness Programme (LAP) was to empower women and girls with the knowledge of the laws related to women, legal rights and duties, to enable them, to share power equally, gain full access to the means of development, and to inspire a whole generation of women to work together towards achieving equality and justice. B. Food Packet Distribution to Widows with Donation from Orphans in Need. Food Packets were distributed to widows with donation from Orphans in Need. In the year 2014-15, Orphans in Need provided a donation of Rs. 210000 to Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. C. Mid Day Meal Expenditure. Mid Day Meal is provided at Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. Education facility is provided to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. An expenditure of Rs. 119300 was made on Mid Day Meal in 2014-15. D. Find Out Disabled Children Program Every year, we organise Disabled Children Programme. Through Community Survey, every year our organization finds 25 disabled children. We provide Education facility to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. Student assessments are implemented throughout the year to evaluate continued enrolment in this program.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We have already given home to 8 orphaned youth (all above 18 years of age), give them a homely enviroment in a kind of family, where they feel loved, cared and secure. sourceOfFunds.purpose: caring for 8 handicapped abandoned youth, send the to school, Vocational Training, provide proper food and medical care and teach them Life Skills (like calender, date, money, sign reading etc)

housing and caring for 8 handicapped abandoned youth in a rented house..4 boys we send to IICP for vocational training, and for 3 boys we found already employment and they draw a small salary...we still teach them at home basic education like maths, english and bengali and keep them busy making paper bags etc

running a small home for handicapped abandoned youth, depending on local donation and member subscription. some of the boys still go to IICP for vocational training (blockprinting, lamination, paper bag making), while 4 boys are employed and draw at small salary. We try to get a piece of land outside Kolkata and will built a small home, all handicapped-friendly, to accommodate more of those helpless handicapped orphans.

for our work for the handicapped abandoned youth we care in our home, we depend fully on private local donation, subscription of members.. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: This is a computer as well as soft skill training Institute. Nevertheless it has several motto. We mainly train computer hardware, software, Spoken English, Nursing training, Personality Development and so on. Apart from this we have a school for kids. We take special care for backward students. In this complicated and competitive society young generation getting hesitated and jobless due to lack of their skills on above mentioned matter. Therefore to make the young generation skillful we trying our level best to have many projects. Meanwhile we are going to have women skill Development programme such as tailoring, Hand craft, Embroidery and so on. Every year we arrange huge skill development programme, Seminars, Awareness camp. We also held many competitions on Drawing, Quiz Contest, Dance, Drama, Music, Recitation, Hand craft among the rural people. Our objective is not only to make the backwards but also all aged and categories people enriched, skillful and efficient. Not only that we also have several future plans. We want to serve on Medical awareness camp and programme on blood donation, AIDS, free eye test and so on. We also taking care of old aged persons. In this society they have no place, Young generation is about to forget the contribution of them. We personally are treating their problems, sufferings, troubles. Recently we conducted garbage cleaning operation with the help of young guys. Above all our service is the total development of the rural people in every corner of the interior. We want to offer a golden independent society on the palm of the government of India.

ngoList.title: BRINDABAN MALLICK LANE DARPANI
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: BRINDABAN MALLICK LANE DARPANI WAS ESTABLISHED ON 1994 WITH THE AIM OF PROMOTING INDIAN CULTURE THROUGHOUT THE WORLD. THE BASIC AIMS AND OBJECTIVES OF TIS INSTITUTION WAS- TO PROMOTE AND PROPAGATE AND PRESERVE AND PERPETUATE THE ART OF CLASSICAL DANCE. TO REVEAL THE TRUE SPIRIT AND FORM OF ART OF CLASSICAL DANCE. TO ESTABLISH SIGNIFICANT CO RELATION BETWEEN THE EXISTENCE FORMS OF CLASSICAL DANCE AND THE AVAILABLE KNOWEDGE OF THE ART OF DANCING. TO ESTABLISH AN ACDEMY FOR IMPARTING TRAINING, RESEARCH AND CREATIVE WORK. TO ORGANISE STAGE PERFORMANCES. TO ORGANISE DANCE TOURS, STAGE PROGRAMMES, EXIBITIONS, RADIO TALKS, SEMINARS, ETC. TO SEEK ASSISTANCE FROM GOVERNMENTAL AND NON-GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES. THE INSTITUTION SINCE ITS ESTABLISHMENT IN 1993 HAS BEEN WORKING FOR PROPAGATNG CLASSICAL DANCE AMONG ALL THE CLASES OF THE SOCIETY. THEY HAVE ORGANISED SEVERAL DANCE PERFORMANCES THROUGHOUT THE WORLD. THE INSTITUTION HAS BEEN WORKING FOR SEVERAL WELL KNOWN NGO LIKE BEHALA RCFC, REACH GOLF GREEN, INSPIRATION LAKE GARDENS, AND SEVERAL OTHER NGO. THE INSTITUTION HAS ORGANISED FUNCTIONS AND HELD CLASSES FOR THE STREET CHILDREN. ORGANISED SHOWS WITH REACH GOLF GREEN FOR THE DEAF AND DUMB, AND ALSO THE MENTALLY RETERDED CHILDREN. THEY HAVE WORKED FOR THE PRESIDENCY JAIL AND ORGANISED DANCE SHOWS WITH THE PRISONERS THERE. THEY HAVE WORKED WITH THE PHYSICALLY CHALLENGED UNDER BEHALA RCFC . ORGANISED SEVERAL CLASSES, WORKSHOPS, UPLIFTMENT PROGRAMMES FOR THE STREET CHILDREN HAND IN HAND WITH INSPIRATION LAKE GARDENS. THE INSTITUTION NOW AIMS AT ORGANISING SEVERAL SOCIAL WELFARE PROGRAMMES THROUGHOUT INDIA. IT ALSO LOOKS FORWARD AT ORGANISING DENCE, DRAMA AND RECITATION CLASSES FOR THE STREET, DEAF AND DUMB,AND THE MENTALLY RETEDED CHILDREN THROUGHOUT ITS WORKING AREA.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Burdwan Alamgunj Education Society is a registered Society under West Bengal Society Registration Act, 1961 (herein after referred as BAES). The Society is formed on 6TH APRIL,2010,, having its own registered office at Address: Alamganj, P.O-Natunganj, Burdwan ,West Bengal , Pin-713102 has started its operation during the year 2010. The Mission of the Society is to promote, advance and encourage and /or aid in helping, promoting, advancing and encouraging primary, secondary and higher education including technical, & vocational skills and empowering the target group with knowledge and skill across various sectors. The Strategic Objectives of the Society includes, establishing various Educational, Technical, and Vocational Institutions, Skill Training Centers etc. and operating such institutions / centers with desired outcome for the benefit of the target group without any profit motive. Society is a affiliated Vocational Training Provider (VTP) under NCVT and also executes the BASIC COMPUTER COURSE of Industrial Training Institutes (ITI) in West Bengal. Following are the training centers under the umbrella of Burdwan Alamgunj Education Society:- 1. Burdwan Alamgunj Education Society, Alamgunj 2. Burdwan Alamgunj Education Society,Nabagram 3. Burdwan Alamgunj Education Society,Patuli,Katwa 4. Burdwan Alamgunj Education Society,Gandhi Market,Katwa 5. Burdwan Alamgunj Education Society,399 G.T Road, Burdwan Following are the ITIs where we executed the BCC Course 1. Government ITI,Durgapur 2. Government ITI,Hooghly 3. Burdwan Womens Government ITI 4. Government ITI ,Kanyapur 5. Asansol Polytechnic. 6. Government ITI,Baharampore. We also had organised a Computer Literacy program at Durgapur Projects Ltd. Also organised 3 months Tailoring & Beutician courses in Neheru Yuva Durgapur, under Govt. Of West Bengal.

ngoList.address: BURDWAN GRAMIN SILPA SAMITY, BARANILPUR ROAD, UTTARPARA, NEAR KAMARPUKUR, P.O.SRIPALLY, BURDWAN-713103, WEST BENGAL.
ngoList.title: BURDWAN GRAMIN SILPA SAMITY
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Burdwan Gramin Silpa Samity is being implemented by silk khadi and muslin khadi production. The Burdwan Gramin Silpa Samity is a registered under West Bengal Societies Registration Act,1961 and certified by Khadi and V.I.Commission (Govt of India). The Samity is engaged in the development programme in the khadi sector with cotton, silk products etc. with view to creating employment opportunities in rural and backward area of Burdwan District. The samity is engaged to make skill artisans in the rural areas of the district. During the financial year 2015-16 the samity has paid wages Rs6.00 lakh to the 60 artisans. The total silk and muslin khadi production was fixed in the year Rs38.00 lakh and achieved Rs37.00 lakh. The Whole sale and Retail sale has been achieved Rs20.00 lakh and Rs12.00 lakh respectively. The samity has also provied training facilities to artisans.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We are a charitable institution, Our Periphery of work is at remote rural areas which cover more than forty villages of Bardhaman and bankura District. Throughout the year we provide free medical treatment to the rural people with medicines and medical backup, doctors of the locality are rendering their selfless services Round the year we are identifying children who have left school in midway.we are motivating and helping them to restart their schooling. We run a school comprising 180 students majority of them belongs to tribal area. we arrange to supply them with free books, copies,dresses and clothes on a regular basis, we also provide them a meal during their school hour at completely free of cost. We also have initiateed a vocational training school for rural tribal women and planning to start a selfhelp group after completion of the training. We are a front runner of the Blood Donation movement, we motivate people to donate blood to keep the lifeline flowing. so far this year we have collected 506 units of blood by motivating different clubs and institutions. We organise free first aid medical camp at various festivals.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Calcutta Kids Trust achievement Calcutta Kids is committed to providing the crucial health and nutrition services during the first 1000 days of life to prevent irreversible damage to childrens long-term health. This is achieved by empowering pregnant women and mothers in the slums of Kolkata. Our goal is to provide services which positively impact childrens growth and development which in turn will help them to break out the cycle of poverty. The Maternal and Young Child Health Initiative (MYCHI ) works to increase access to healthcare for pregnant women, and provide strong start to children in their first 1000 days of life,the crucial window of opportunity during which 80% of the brain development occurs. We have achieved For institutional delivery in our catchment area (Government or private) Before Calcutta Kids Trust intervention 67% of mother had institutional delivery, with Calcutta Kids intervention over 95% mothers have institutional delivery. Regarding initiated breastfeeding within 2 hours of birth Before Calcutta Kids trust intervention only 8% of mothers did such initiation, with Calcutta Kids intervention 70% of mother did such initiation in our Catchment area. Regarding fed colostrum to the new born Before Calcutta Kids Trust intervention only 28% women fed colostrums,with Calcutta Kids Trust intervention 90% fed colostrum in our Catchment area. Regarding birth weight Before Calcutta Kids Trust intervention average birth weight was 1.8KGs, with Calcutta Kids Trust Intervention Average birth weight is 2.6KGs, in our catchment area 75% of women had babies weighing greater than 2.5 KGs 41% of those women had babies weighing greater than 3 KGs. Calcutta Kids Trust is a winner finalist organization of 2009 Grant Competition South Asia Innovate for Nutrition held on 4-5 August 2009 at Dhaka , Bangladesh. Calcutta Kids is a recipient of the 30th annual caring Award for the year 2015 for the selfless service to the dying , disabled and disadvantaged. Honorable US consul General of Kolkata, Dean Thompson visit to Calcutta Kids in the year November 2012 and letter of Appreciation for Calcutta Kids amazing work for Slum children and mother. Once again Honorable US consulate General Kolkata Mr. Craig L Hall visit to Calcutta Kids as on 21st of June 2016 and issued an appreciation letter mentioning as works of Calcutta Kids Trust is a great example of Indian and US friends working together.

members.name: Sri Krishna Pada Bhattacharya Krishna Pada Bhattacharya

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The organization has three major activities 1 Service 2 Research 3 Publication Under activity 1, organization runs two Day Care Centers for the under privilege elderly (60+). Beneficiaries of these two day care centers are frail in health, are obviously malnourished, and utterly neglected by their family members. They visit our Organization at around 11am each day, stay a few hours ( till 4pm), and all this while they are actively involved in mostly recreational activities like watching television, preparing hand -made paper bags, or just chatting away within themselves. The Organization thus provides a source of relief and much needed support for these neglected masses of our society. The Organization runs one Mobile Medicare Unit to provide primary medical facilities to nearly 400 beneficiaries living in 8 slum areas of the city. The Organization has qualified doctors, social workers, and organizers for managing these camps. Research is the strength of the Organization. It has a proven record of conducting various research themes sponsored by ICSSR, WHO, INSA and many other reputed Organizations. Of late, research activities are spreading in the technical domain as well. Fall among the elderly is one of the primary study topics. The Organization maintains a small lab for trials and tests in respect of technology intervention of the research work. Publication is yet another domain of activity of the Organization. Quarterly journal Ageing & Society, The Indian Journal of Gerontology are published regularly. These journals are the platform of researchers in the field of Gerontology all over India and Bangladesh. Quality papers published in these journals are reviewed for doctoral degrees of various universities in India and abroad. The Organization generates awareness in the society against the elderly abuse and also create awareness amongst the elderly for their rights, benefits, and special concessions . Our Organization is always invited in the state and national forum for policy matters and framing the acts and other regulations. Training is yet another prime activity of the Organization. Geriatric care givers of different varieties and duration of training are produced by the Organization in collaboration with NISD. These trainees render services to the elderly at the community level. In recognition to the performance, MSJ&E recognized the Organization as a Center of Excellence for disseminating knowledge in the field of Geriatric care and conferred the  Vayoshreshtha Sam man for Institution of knowledge in the year 2006. University of Calcutta and University Sterling, UK, have conferred the responsibility of carrying post-graduate studies in the field of Gerontology and Dementia respectively. Since the year 2013, the Organization as RRTC on Ageing under MSJ&E

ngoList.title: CALCUTTA PERFORMERS
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Calcutta Performers, a Theatre Group, registered under West Bengal Societies Registration Act 1961 was founded in 1991. This year the Group has completed it 20th glorious years of existence. Since inception the Group is committed to better theatre. It has staged more than fifteen productions in the past twenty years. Calcutta Performers first marked its presence with Badal Sarkars Prolap, a serious comedy, which was a runaway success. Prolap was followed by Molieres Tartuffe in 1992. Tartuffe became so popular that Kolkata Doordarshan televised the play and till date it is considered one of the best plays produced by them. John Steinbecks The Moon is Down was dramatized in Bengali (Astamukhi Chand) and performed in 1995. Tagores Chirakumar Sabha (1997), however, remained the most critically acclaimed production so far and till date the Group performed more that hundred sgows. In 2002, the group performed Sekhar Samaddars Bhul Bhulayia. This was followed by The Merchant of Venice in 2004. This production, with its limitations, gained huge admiration from the theatre critics. All the three plays namely Tartuffe, The Moon is Down and The Merchant of Venice were translated by Tamal Rai Chowdhury. The group took a break soon after this production and resurrected in 2008 with Surya Sens Bablu Kokhon Asbe. This was followed by Rash Leela (2009), Bengali adaptation of a French play by Jean Anouille. This adaptation was done by Lokenath Banerjee. In 2010, Calcutta Performers staged Mondo Meyer Bhalo Kotha, a translation of The Respectable Prostitute by Jean-Paul Sartre. This was also translated by Tamal Rai Chowdhury. Though it would not be out of place that not a stage production we did Molieres The Imaginary Invalid, a tele play where the redoubtable Kali Banerjee played in the lead role if the Hypochondriac. Calcutta Performers also regularly organizes lectures, seminars and symposiums to enhance its repertoire. The most recent being the one held at Star Theatre, Kolkata on the subject of Censorship in Plays, where a galaxy of intellectuals, scholars, directors and actors including Soumitra Chatterjee, Shamik Bandyopadhyay, Anup Motilal, Suman Mukhopadhyay and Kaushik Sen deliberated animatedly in a packed auditorium.
